snippet: Gen. Martin E. Dempsey was circumspect in describing the sort of broad effort that would be required to roll back ISIS in Syria and Iraq.
abstract: Joint Chiefs of Staff Chairman Gen Martin E Dempsey says Islamic State in Iraq and Syria cannot be defeated unless United States or its allies go after Sunni militants in Syria; Dempsey remains circumspect in describing what sort of effort would be required to roll back ISIS in Syria and Iraq; neither Dempsey nor Defense Sec Chuck Hagel indicate that Pres Obama is ready to approve airstrikes in Syria.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and HELENE COOPER
byline.contributor: Ben Hubbard contributed reporting from Baghdad, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Gen. Martin E. Dempsey was circumspect in describing the sort of broad effort that would be required to roll back ISIS in Syria and Iraq.

headline.main: U.S. General Says Raiding Syria Is Key to Halting ISIS
headline.print_headline: U.S. General Says Raiding Syria Is Key to Halting ISIS

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
